full_title_en: STONE Nephrolithometry Score for Renal Calculi
medium_description_en: Predicts recurrence of kidney stone based on radiological criteria.
short_description_en: Predicts renal stone recurrence, after CT.

seo.meta_description_en: The STONE Nephrolithotomy Scoring System predicts severity of kidney stone based radiological visualization.
seo.keywords_en: stone score, stone neph score, stone Nephrolithotomy score, Nephrolithotomy score, Nephrolithotomy scoring system, renal stone score, kidney stone score, kidney stone severity score, renal calculi, renal colic, urine blockage score, renal colic score, radiologic renal score, kidney stone severity CT

how_to_use.use_case_en: The patient with renal -- not ureteral -- stones.
how_to_use.why_use_en: Patients with renal stones can be difficult to assess and prognosticate.

next_steps.management_en: Patients with low likelihoods of being stone-free can have their expectations managed pre-operatively, understanding that they may require additional interventions later.

Nephrolithometry: Novel Surgical Classification System for Kidney Calculi, Urology, Volume 81, Issue 6, June 2013, Pages 1154-1160, ISSN 0090-4295, http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.urology.2012.10.083.

Other References.text: Kevin Labadie, Zhamshid Okhunov, Arash Akhavein, Daniel Moreira, Jorge Moreno-Palacios, Michael del Junco, Zeph Okeke, Vincent Bird, Arthur D. Smith and Jaime Landman. Evaluation and Comparison of Urolithiasis Scoring Systems in Percutaneous Kidney Stone Surgery. Journal of Urology. Vol. 193, 1-6, January 2015.

Validation.text: Akhavein A, Henriksen C, Syed J, Bird VG. Prediction of single procedure success rate using S.T.O.N.E. nephrolithometry surgical classification system with strict criteria for surgical outcome. Urology. 2015 Jan;85(1):69-73. doi: 10.1016/j.urology.2014.09.010.

creator_info.about_en: Zeph Okeke, MD, is a practicing urologic surgeon, specializing in endourology, minimally invasive surgery and laparoscopy, at North Shore-LIJ Medical Group. He is also an assistant professor at Hofstra North Shore-LIJ School of Medicine and co-director of the Smith Institute for Urology endourology and laparoscopy fellowship training programs. Dr. Okeke's research interests include surgical outcomes of kidney stone patients and grading, and characterizing complex kidney stones to guide surgery.
